g.text: 1.2.1. Prepare Handler Consume (single message, includes individual transfers from Bulk)
Validate event - Rule: type IN ['prepare', 'bulk-prepare'] && action == 'prepare'
Schema validation of the incoming message
Verify the message's signature (to be confirmed in future requirement)
The above validation steps are already handled by
the ML-Adapter for the open source implementation.
It may need to be added in future for custom adapters.
Request to retrieve Transfer Hash for a transferId
Request Transfer Hash for a transferId
Generate Hash for the incoming message and compare hashes
For individual transfers in a bulk, attributes
such as payer, payee, expiry time, etc. need
to be added before the hash is generated (in bulk-prepare).
Request to retrieve fulfilment, completedTimestamp for the transferId
Request fulfilment, completedTimestamp for the transferId
Publish Notification (failure) event for the Payer
For the Data Model, refer to the final step in this diagram (has the same text).
This request can be ignored, because a callback is about to be sent to the client.
Send /error callback with appropriate error message
Publish Prepare Duplicate event to Bulk Processing Topic
(for the individual transfer) with the current transferState
Publish Prepare failure event to Bulk Processing Topic
(for the individual transfer) with the current transferState
Reference: Failure in Prepare Transfer Validation
The validation of Payer, Payee can be skipped for individual transfers in Bulk
as they should've/would've been validated already in the bulk prepare part.
However, leaving it here for now, as in the future, this can be leveraged
when bulk transfers to multiple Payees are supported by the Specification.
Request to retrieve Payer Participant details (if it exists)
Return Participant details if it exists
Return Participant details if it exists
Request to retrieve Payee Participant details (if it exists)
Return Participant details if it exists
Return Participant details if it exists
Persist Transfer State (with transferState='INVALID') (Introducing a new status INVALID to mark these entries)
Reference: Failure in Prepare Transfer Validation
Route & Publish Position event for Payer
Route & Publish Position event for Payer
Reference: Failure in Prepare Transfer Validation
Publish Prepare failure event to Bulk Processing Topic (for Payer)
